Methods

| Improve this Doc View Source

InvokeFunctionAsync(IKernel, Ask, String, String)

Invoke a Semantic Kernel function on the server.

Declaration
[Authorize]
[Route("skills/{skillName}/functions/{functionName}/invoke")]
[HttpPost]
[ProducesResponseType(200)]
[ProducesResponseType(400)]
[ProducesResponseType(404)]
public async Task<ActionResult<Answer>> InvokeFunctionAsync([FromServices] IKernel kernel, [FromBody] Ask ask, string skillName, string functionName)
Parameters
Type Name Description
Microsoft.SemanticKernel.IKernel kernel

Semantic kernel obtained through dependency injection.
Ask ask

Prompt along with its parameters.
System.String skillName

Skill in which function to invoke resides.
System.String functionName

Name of function to invoke.
Returns
Type Description
System.Threading.Tasks.Task<Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.ActionResult<Answer>>

Results consisting of text generated by invoked function along with the variable in the Semantic Kernel that generated it.
Remarks

We create and use a new kernel for each request. We feed the kernel the ask received via POST from the client and attempt to invoke the function with the given name.

Extension Methods

ArrayHelper.IntoArray<T>(T)
